byline.contributor: Clifford Krauss reported from Houston, and Nelson D. Schwartz from New York.
byline.original: By CLIFFORD KRAUSS and NELSON D. SCHWARTZ

abstract: Unemployment rate in Texas is well below national average of 5.4 percent, but oil industry is losing jobs as falling oil prices cause shut downs in drilling and production; supporters of former Gov Rick Perry say policies during his tenure were vital to job growth, but many economists say differences in state policies have only limited role in encouraging economic prosperity.
lead_paragraph: The backers of former Gov. Rick Perry say his policies spurred jobs, but many economists contend that differences in state policies play a limited role in fueling growth.

headline.main: Rick Perry Hones His Image as ‘Texas Miracle’ Fades
headline.print_headline: As Texas’ ‘Miracle’ Fades, a Closer Look at Policy

snippet: The backers of former Gov. Rick Perry say his policies spurred jobs, but many economists contend that differences in state policies play a limited role in fueling growth.
